subject: Fix memory leak and add EINTR error handling.
commitMessage:
Fix memory leak and add EINTR error handling.

One memory leak was missed in the Installer service.
Introduce retries on EINTR error while trying to open a file.
Also add close() error handling.

Change-Id: I946ba0b7effbe8a2fd429a86d5d7b387be076546
Signed-off-by: Marcin Lis <m.lis@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Just noticed 2 typos

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for spotting this. But your handling of close() error should be adjusted.

In the future please split such change into separate commits: one for memleak, the other for error handling.

Patch Set 4:

I added EIO error handling on close.

Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Please merge this commit. It is verified.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add smackfs check to Installer service.
commitMessage:
Add smackfs check to Installer service.

The app installation was failing under the non-smack environment.
One additional check for the existence of the smack is now added to
prevent the Installer from applying smack rules to the kernel, when
there is no smack security enabled.

The same kind of check is also added to uninstall-app functionality.

Change-Id: I9ed29e7d60e34639173317ac83c1f5314100d6e4
Signed-off-by: Marcin Lis <m.lis@samsung.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: security manager: function for labeling dirs
commitMessage:
security manager: function for labeling dirs

Security manager used libprivilege-control's perm_app_setup_path.
This commit removes this dependency by reimplementing the code
that labels directories as internal function of installer service
in security-manager.

Change-Id: I57738ef310afddda235fe2bb45d95ee54d2ed587
Signed-off-by: Jan Cybulski <j.cybulski@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Much better, but I had to whine some more. :)

Patch Set 6:

I added comments inline to patch set 5.

Patch Set 6:

Maybe i should divide it into two commits: on that adds new file with commons and generate_app_label inside and second, that adds setupPath into installerService?
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Installation/uninstallation of package-specific smack rules
commitMessage:
Installation/uninstallation of package-specific smack rules

On installation rules are generated from predefined template, applied
to the kernel and saved to disk so they are loaded on system boot.
On uninstallation package-specific rules are revoked from kernel and
removed from disk.

Change-Id: Ib3ce4ecf909c4fe3c6bc1f5a77e24737b7acf918

comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

I've tested it on m0 with slightly modified code:
 - generateAppLabel returns User2 so it doesn't mess with existing rules
 - uninstallPackageSmackRules call is uncommented and its argument is changed to hardcoded pkgId of the widget I installed previously

Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Thank you for moving to SmackRules class, I like it. Please make few more adjustments.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Change socket paths from /tmp... to /run...
commitMessage:
Change socket paths from /tmp... to /run...

[Cause]        Sockets should not be created in /tmp folder
[Solution]     Change systemd socket description
               and protocol defines

[Verification] Build and install Security Server.
               Check if sockets created by systemd are placed in:
               /run/security-server and /run/security-manager

Change-Id: I3f480808d2d3f1bd78b8713d795602da7ccc7dfb
Signed-off-by: Lukasz Wojciechowski <l.wojciechow@partner.samsung.com>

[Verificaiton] N/A

Change-Id: I1c035ae968367be778c8ba725e9000d07df078c2

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Comment out Security-server API checking privileges of process
commitMessage:
Comment out Security-server API checking privileges of process

Below Security-server APIs can be return 'access deny" by 3-domain smack policy.
And it makes bootting and running issue.
So we should comment out them temporarily untill implement of Cynara. 
- security_server_check_privilege_by_sockfd
- security_server_check_privilege_by_pid
- security_server_check_privilege_by_cookie

visit below site:
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Security:Cynara

Change-Id: Idcf379a1cd6ee38c80d21b952cdf52b067813603
Signed-off-by: jooseong.lee <jooseong.lee@samsung.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why do we need to consider Smack is offed?

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

This changes is needed for fixing bugs. TIVI-2057

The first version of this changes is : https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/11866/
 
and concern only the smack label pkgmgr::svc and pkgmgr::info.


The smack label pkgmgr::svc and pkgmgr::info  are should be set by using package manifest of pkgmgr-server
But as manifest are set to default floor without set this label. 
The cookie check always fails in pkgmgr-server.

As Casey suggest in the review https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/11866/ if it is better to disable this check at security-server level.

The goal of this patch is to not check smack label that do not exist (due to reset of manifest).

Please review your note or tell me if I need to re-commit the first version of this patch ( concerning only pkgmgr-server) Thanks

Patch Set 1:

Open a JIRA noting that Smack is not being considered and that  once the overall labeling scheme settles in place the correct labels need to be identified and used. That should get us past the current impasse.

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

The event_callback is not correctly transmitted to the system
observer thread. Change so_config into static variable

subject: Cleanup spec and remove defunct system V startup scripts
commitMessage:
Cleanup spec and remove defunct system V startup scripts

Fix several rpmlint errors and removed the pointless startup script
from the source and all the logic for installing it in the spec

subject: smack API has changed; smack_new_label_from socket returns the label length.
commitMessage:
smack API has changed; smack_new_label_from socket returns the label
length.
